message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY, cs.HC 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with sentiment analysis and sarcasm detection in user-generated short text and sentences. It also proposes to augment traditional features with cognitive features derived from eye-movement patterns of readers, which falls under the domain of natural language processing. 

It could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as the paper uses statistical classification to improve the performance of polarity detection. 

Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.CY (Computers and Society) as the paper discusses the implications of sentiment analysis on social media and user-generated content. 

Finally, it could be classified under cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) as the paper proposes to use cognitive features to improve sentiment analysis, which involves understanding how humans interact with technology.
